On Sunday 16th October,2022, for our last performance in Rumphi we went to the village of Bowe, where we received a warm welcome from local villagers. 
The teachers in each local village were essential in helping us ask the audiences questions about the activities, which will be important for our research. There was a great football match between Bowe vs Betere and the local netball teams played really well too.
This, being our last performance in Rumphi, was very successful and we had lots of good questions about African Trypanosomiasis from the crowd.
ny: Pa Lamlungu 16 October,2022, pa chionetsero chathu chomaliza ku Rumphi tinapita kumudzi wa Bowe, komwe tinalandiridwa ndi anthu akumudzi. Panali masewera abwino a mpira pakati pa Bowe vs Betere ndipo magulu am'deralo a netball adasewera bwino kwambiri. Izi, pokhala chionetsero chathu chomaliza ku Rumphi, zidayenda bwino kwambiri ndipo tinali ndi mafunso ambiri abwino okhudza African Trypanosomiasis kuchokera pagulu.

en: PUBLIC STATEMENT ON THE FUTURE OF MALAWI LEADERSHIP
ny: ZOLINGA ZA PULIMA ZOKHUDZA M'tsogolo mwa utsogoleri wa Malawi

en: Introduction
ny: Mawu Oyamba

en: Fellow Malawians, it is with great conviction and patriotism for my country, that I have decided to speak on issues that are affecting us all. I say conviction and patriotism for my country because in taking this stand, I am well aware of the associated risks to me personally, my family and my colleagues. However, my personal comfort plays subordinate to the national good. It is on that basis that I have braved to make this statement.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndi chikhulupiriro komanso kukonda dziko lathu, kuti ndaganiza zokamba nkhani zomwe zikukhudza tonsefe. Ndikunena kuti ndikukhulupirira komanso kukonda dziko langa chifukwa ndikulankhula izi, ndikudziwa zoopsa zomwe zikukhudzana ndi ine, banja langa ndi anzanga. Komabe, chitonthozo changa chimakhala chocheperako kuposa zabwino za dziko. Ndi chifukwa chake ndalimba mtima kunena izi.

en: I am inspired by the many brave Malawians who have come before me. From the time of Reverend John Chilembwe to Dr. Kamuzu Banda, who fought against a white establishment for us to attain political independence. I am inspired by the likes of Dr. Bakili Muluzi, late Chakufwa Chihana, late Aleke Banda and all those who braved the one-party system in the early 1990s for us to have democracy. These Malawians knew the risks so well but put the interest of the nation far ahead of their personal interests. If it were not for their sacrifices, perhaps we would until today be under colonial rule or under one-party system. This statement I am making is a fruit of their sacrifices. I am personally indebted to them all.
ny: Ndimalimbikitsidwa ndi anthu ambiri olimba mtima a ku Malawi omwe anabwera ine ndisanabadwe. Kuyambira nthawi ya Reverend John Chilembwe mpaka Dr. Kamuzu Banda, amene anamenya nkhondo yolimbana ndi anthu oyera kuti tipeze ufulu wa ndale. Ndimalimbikitsidwa ndi anthu monga Dr. Bakili Muluzi, malemu Chakufwa Chihana, malemu Aleke Banda ndi onse omwe adatsutsa dongosolo la chipani chimodzi koyambirira kwa zaka za m'ma 1990 kuti tikhale ndi demokalase. Amalawi awa amadziwa zoopsa koma amaika chidwi cha dziko patsogolo pa zofuna zawo. Pakadapanda kudzipereka kwawo, mwina mpaka lero tikadakhala pansi paulamuliro wa atsamunda kapena pansi pa dongosolo la chipani chimodzi. Mawu awa omwe ndikunena ndi chipatso cha kudzipereka kwawo. Ndine wokondedwa ndi onsewa.

en: Malawi is a country well-endowed with natural resources and a predominantly youthful and energetic human resource which unfortunately is currently under- utilized. Malawi has everything required for her people to economically develop except it lacks effective leadership. Our development challenges have remained the same. Economic growth rate remains low, children still learn under a tree, health facilities are poorly resourced, some people have yet to have access to safe drinking water, agriculture is largely rain-fed and subsistence, markets for agricultural produce are weak and unpredictable, few people own houses in urban areas and only few houses in rural areas are permanent, transport system is inefficient and expensive, university students from low income households continue to face the risk of withdrawal on account of lack of tuition fee or upkeep expenses, small and medium enterprises cannot grow because the business environment is less conducive and some districts have yet to have tarmac road until now.
ny: Malawi ndi dziko lokhala ndi chuma chambiri komanso anthu ambiri achinyamata komanso amphamvu omwe mwatsoka pakadali pano sagwiritsidwa ntchito mokwanira. Malawi ili ndi zonse zofunika kuti anthu ake akule bwino pachuma kupatula kuti ilibe utsogoleri wogwira mtima. Zovuta zathu pakukula zakhala zofanana. Kukula kwachuma kukucheperachepera, ana amaphunzirabe pansi pa mtengo, malo azaumoyo alibe zinthu zambiri, anthu ena alibe madzi akumwa abwino, ulimi ndiwambiri ndi mvula komanso moyo, misika yazogulitsa zaulimi ndi yofooka komanso yosadalirika, anthu ochepa ali ndi nyumba m'mizinda ndipo nyumba zochepa zokha m'midzi ndizokhalitsa, kayendedwe ka kayendedwe sikokwanira komanso okwera mtengo, ophunzira aku yunivesite ochokera kumabanja omwe amapeza ndalama zochepa akupitilizabe kuthana ndi chiopsezo chosiya chifukwa chosowa ndalama zolipirira maphunziro kapena kukonza, mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono ndi apakatikati sangakule chifukwa malo abizinesi ndi osavomerezeka ndipo madera ena alibe misewu mpaka pano.

en: In fact, if one reads the priorities in the 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan and compare with priorities in the Statement of Development Policies in 1970s to mid- 1990s, then read Vision 2020 and then read Malawi 2063, it is clear that our priorities have remained the same. The reason they have remained the same is because they remain challenges because we have not made noticeable improvement as a country. The reason they remain challenges is because no leadership has addressed any key priority exhaustively. We still discuss food insecurity. We still discuss poor access to safe drinking water. We still discuss lack of all-weather roads in some areas. We still discuss poor access to electricity. We still discuss lack of profitable markets for farmers. We still discuss high unemployment especially among the youth.
ny: M'malo mwake, ngati wina awerenga zoyambirira mu Nyasaland Development Plan ya 1965 ndikuziyerekeza ndi zoyambirira mu Statement of Development Policies mzaka za m'ma 1970 mpaka pakati pa zaka za m'ma 1990, kenako werengani Vision 2020 ndikuwerenga Malawi 2063, zikuwonekeratu kuti zoyambirira zathu zakhala zofanana. Chifukwa chomwe zakhala zofanana ndi chifukwa chakuti zikadali zovuta chifukwa sitinachite bwino ngati dziko. Chifukwa chomwe zikadali zovuta ndi chifukwa chakuti palibe utsogoleri womwe wakhudza chilichonse chofunikira kwambiri. Timakambiranabe za kusowa kwa chakudya. Timakambiranabe za mwayi wopezeka ndi madzi akumwa abwino. Timakambiranabe za kusowa kwa misewu yamtundu uliwonse m'malo ena. Timakambiranabe za kusowa kwa magetsi. Timakambiranabe za kusowa kwa misika yopindulitsa kwa alimi. Timakambiranabe za ulova waukulu makamaka pakati pa achinyamata.

en: Economy
ny: Zochitika pa zachuma

en: Fellow Malawians, our economy remains small, vulnerable to shocks and we continue carrying the Least Developed Country label. Even more irritating is that countries which have been at war or in conflict have economies stronger than ours. The weak economy we have is not the make of nature. It is the make of our leaders. While acknowledging periods of progress, such periods have been episodic and short-lived.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, chuma chathu chikadali chochepa, chofooka ndipo tikukhalabe ndi dzina loti dziko lopanda chitukuko. Chomwe chimatikwiyitsa kwambiri n'chakuti mayiko omwe akhala pa nkhondo kapena nkhondo ali ndi chuma cholimba kuposa chathu. Chuma chofooka chomwe tili nacho sichichokera ku chilengedwe. Ndichochokera kwa atsogoleri athu. Ngakhale kuti timavomereza kuti zinthu zikuyenda bwino, nthawi zoterezi zakhala zikuchitika mwa apo ndi apo ndipo zakhala zosakhalitsa.

en: Malawi has capacity to feed itself and other countries given its abundant water resources for irrigation. Malawi has capacity to substitute imports and to increase exports and in so doing improve her balance of payments, stabilize exchange rate and contain inflation rate. Malawi has capacity to manage its own budget without heavy borrowing.
ny: Malawi ali ndi mphamvu yodzipezera chakudya komanso kudyetsa mayiko ena chifukwa cha madzi ambiri omwe ali nawo othirira. Malawi ali ndi mphamvu zobweretsera katundu kunja ndi kuwonjezera katundu wake kunja ndipo potero amawongolera ndalama zake, kukhazikika kwa ndalama ndi kuchepetsa kuchepa kwa ndalama. Malawi ali ndi mphamvu zoyendetsera bajeti yake popanda kubwereka kwambiri.

en: Sadly, people we have put in position of power to advance our common interests have opted to pursue personal interests, maintain luxuries and perpetuate the status quo at the expense of common Malawians whom they are meant to serve. There is both outright impunity and institutionalized impunity. An example of institutionalized impunity is the heaping of allowance entitlements to cabinet members and senior government officers when middle and junior level officers continue earning low salaries.
ny: Anthu amene tinawaika paudindo kuti apititse patsogolo zofuna zathu, mwachisoni anasankha kuchita zofuna zawo, kukhala ndi moyo wapamwamba ndi kusunga zomwe zikuchitika m'dzikoli, zomwe zikuwononga anthu wamba a ku Malawi omwe akuyenera kuwatumikira.

en: We have a system which just fuel allowance entitlement of a cabinet member is worth more than a salary of a Principal Secretary and fuel allowance entitlement of a Principal Secretary is worth more than a salary of a middle level officer. The same is the case in state owned enterprises.
ny: Tili ndi dongosolo limene malipiro a m'kabineti a mafuta ndi ofunika kwambiri kuposa malipiro a mlembi wamkulu ndipo malipiro a mlembi wamkulu ndi ofunika kwambiri kuposa malipiro a mkulu wa pakati.

en: I stand with you; teachers, police officers, healthcare workers, agriculture extension workers and many others whose salary is a fraction of just one allowance entitlement of a senior public officer and a minister. Surely, this is institutionalized impunity and must stop.
ny: Ndimakhala nanu; aphunzitsi, apolisi, ogwira ntchito zaumoyo, ogwira ntchito zaulimi ndi ena ambiri omwe malipiro awo ndi gawo la malipiro amodzi okha a mkulu wa boma ndi nduna. Zowonadi, izi ndizokhazikitsidwa ndipo ziyenera kutha.

en: I stand with you parents whose children are learning under a tree. I stand with you families who are struggling to put food on the table. I stand with you families whose sick relatives are sent back from hospital without receiving treatment. I stand with you, university students, who are struggling to meet upkeep expenses. I stand with you who are looking for a job which you are not able to find. I stand with you farmers who have been at subsistence level without hope of growing to a higher level. Your next government will stand with you. It will be a government whose job is to offer solutions and will address the challenges you are facing. You can count on me.
ny: Ndimakulimbikitsani inu makolo amene ana anu akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo. Ndimakulimbikitsani inu mabanja amene mukuvutika kuti mupeze chakudya. Ndimakulimbikitsani inu mabanja amene achibale awo odwala akubweretsedwa kuchipatala popanda kulandira chithandizo. Ndimakulimbikitsani inu ophunzira a ku yunivesite, amene mukuvutika kuti mupeze ndalama zogulira zinthu zofunika pamoyo. Ndimakulimbikitsani inu amene mukufufuza ntchito koma simukupeza.

en: Fellow Malawians, I believe in the potential of our country and in Malawians. We read positive stories about economic success of Rwanda. Zambia has just changed narrative since their current government came in office later than our current government and we are hearing positive stories. There is no reason other than poor leadership, that stories for Malawi that make international news headlines are poverty, hunger and corruption involving high profile public officers.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ine ndikhulupilira mu mphamvu ya dziko lathu ndi a Malawi. Timawerenga nkhani zabwino za kupambana kwa chuma cha Rwanda. Zambia yasintha nkhani kuyambira pomwe boma lawo laposachedwa lidayamba kugwira ntchito kuposa boma lathu lamakono ndipo tikumva nkhani zabwino. Palibe chifukwa china koma utsogoleri wofooka, kuti nkhani za Malawi zomwe zimapanga mitu ya nkhani zapadziko lonse ndi umphawi, njala ndi ziphuphu zomwe zimakhudza akuluakulu aboma.

en: I feel the pain we are all going through in the tough economic times. I acknowledge that part of the reasons for the economic challenges are external factors such as a war in Ukraine and tropical cyclones. However, as I have said time and again in various media interviews, the external factors have just contributed. A large part of the challenges is our own making. The past national budgets by the current political administration were poorly prepared, not transformative and did not build foundation for macroeconomic stability. I said it in 2020 and have consistently said this. The problems we are going through were anticipated and I did not keep quiet, I shared my views then.
ny: Ndikumva ululu womwe tonsefe tikukumana nawo munthawi zovuta zachuma. Ndikuvomereza kuti chimodzi mwazifukwa zomwe mavuto azachuma ali kunja monga nkhondo ku Ukraine ndi mphepo zamkuntho. Komabe, monga ndidanenera mobwerezabwereza pamafunso osiyanasiyana atolankhani, zinthu zakunja zangothandizira. Zovuta zambiri ndi zomwe tidapanga. Bajeti zam'mbuyomu ndi oyang'anira andale omwe adakonzedwa kale anali osakonzekera bwino, osasinthika ndipo sanapange maziko okhazikika pachuma. Ndinanena izi mu 2020 ndipo ndakhala ndikunena izi. Mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo anali akuyembekezeredwa ndipo sindinakhale chete, ndidagawana malingaliro anga pamenepo.

en: The fast-rising public debt is testimony of lack of fiscal discipline. We were reminded a month ago that every Malawian is carrying on our shoulders a debt burden of K600,000. Unfortunately, this is not debt that financed programs to improve the living standard of us all. This is debt that financed corruption and luxury of senior officers. There has been limited interest to reform the fiscal plan – to remove or reduce unnecessary expenditure items and to grow the revenue base by increasing resource allocation to productive sectors. Additionally, there has been high level inefficiency in government resulting in delays to approve projects. The State President himself and some ministers have admitted this in public. Delay to approve projects locks up foreign exchange since most projects are donor- funded, delays job opportunities and delays development outcomes. These are the main reasons we are going through difficult times. If the leadership was up to task, the extent of suffering would be less than is the case.

en: My colleagues and I come to offer genuine transformation. Malawi is a natural resource-rich and labour-abundant economy. Our economic policy will revolve around maximizing the potential in agriculture, mining, tourism and developing the human resource both in its own right and as catalysts for manufacturing. This will be done while progressively moving towards a knowledge economy by investing in science and technology.
ny: Ine ndi anzanga tabwera kudzapereka kusintha kwenikweni. Malawi ndi chuma cholemera ndi chuma chochuluka. Ndondomeko yathu ya zachuma idzayang'ana kwambiri kuthekera kwa ulimi, migodi, zokopa alendo ndi chitukuko cha anthu onse mwaokha komanso monga othandizira kupanga. Izi zidzachitika pamene tikupita patsogolo ku chuma chidziwitso mwa kuyika ndalama mu sayansi ndi teknoloji.

en: I will implement Malawi 2063 in its entirety. I am happy to inform you, fellow Malawians, that Malawi 2063 is a document I intimately subscribe to, because I was one of the reviewers. I also co-reviewed the enabler on enhanced public sector performance in the Malawi 2063 first 10 years Implementation Plan. My being identified as a person who could review this enabler is testimony that I understand the public service and I know how to make it perform. When I say I will implement it fully, I know what is in the document and I have adequate passion to implement it. I emphasize I because the responsibility for implementing a strategic plan in any organization is vested in the head of the organization. What makes a strategy work for one organization and fail for the other organization, is the quality of leadership of the organization. I will provide quality leadership.
ny: Ndidzakhazikitsa Malawi 2063 m'zonse. Ndine wokondwa kukudziwitsani, a Malawi anzanga, kuti Malawi 2063 ndi chikalata chomwe ndimavomereza kwambiri, chifukwa ndinali m'modzi mwa owunikira. Ndinawunikiranso zomwe zingathandize pakukweza magwiridwe antchito aboma ku Malawi 2063 zaka 10 zoyambirira Kukhazikitsa Dongosolo. Kuzindikiridwa kwanga ngati munthu yemwe angawunikenso izi ndi umboni woti ndimamvetsetsa ntchito zaboma ndipo ndikudziwa momwe ndingachitire. Ndikamanena kuti ndizikhazikitsa kwathunthu, ndikudziwa zomwe zili m'chikalatachi ndipo ndili ndi chidwi chochita. Ndimatsindika chifukwa udindo wokhazikitsa dongosolo lamagulu m'bungwe lililonse uli pamutu wa bungweli. Chomwe chimapangitsa kuti njira igwire ntchito m'bungwe lina ndikulephera kwa bungwe lina, ndi mtundu wa utsogoleri wa bungweli. Ndidzapereka utsogoleri wabwino.

en: We will transform agriculture through Mega farms and cooperatives which will facilitate mechanization, improve productivity, promote access to reliable markets for farmers, catalyze industrialization and urbanization. We will embark on infrastructure revolution agenda. From electricity generation, transport and ICT to residential and government office buildings.
ny: Tidzasintha ulimi kudzera m'mafamu akuluakulu ndi m'mabungwe ogwirira ntchito omwe adzathandize makina, kupititsa patsogolo zokolola, kulimbikitsa mwayi wopeza misika yodalirika kwa alimi, kulimbikitsa kukhazikitsidwa kwa mafakitale ndi kukhazikika m'mizinda. Tidzayamba ntchito yosintha zomangamanga. Kuchokera pakupanga magetsi, mayendedwe ndi ICT kupita ku nyumba zogona ndi maofesi aboma.

en: We will decisively support micro, small and medium enterprises. We will identify those which Malawi has comparative and competitive advantage to produce and have niche markets in the region and prioritize support to them. One key performance indicator for the Ministry of Industrialization and Trade will be the number of micro-scale enterprises graduating into small-scale; the number of small-scale enterprises graduating into medium-scale; the number of medium-scale graduating into large-scale annually. We will encourage and support Malawian large-scale enterprises to become multinational corporations. We denounce the glorification of the MSME concept as if that is the ideal destiny for them. They will be helped to grow.
ny: Tidzathandiza mwamphamvu mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono, ang'onoang'ono ndi apakatikati. Tidzazindikira omwe Malawi ali ndi mwayi woyerekeza ndi mpikisano wopanga ndi kukhala ndi misika yaying'ono m'derali ndikuwathandiza. Chisonyezo chimodzi chofunikira cha Unduna wa Zamakampani ndi Zamalonda chidzakhala kuchuluka kwa mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amapita ku yaying'ono; kuchuluka kwa mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amapita ku sing'anga; kuchuluka kwa mabizinesi apakatikati omwe amapita ku zikuluzikulu pachaka. Tilimbikitsa ndi kuthandizira mabizinesi akuluakulu aku Malawi kuti akhale makampani amitundu yambiri. Timatsutsa kutamandidwa kwa lingaliro la MSME ngati kuti ndi tsogolo labwino kwa iwo. Athandizidwa kukula.

en: There are four main ways in which a country can benefit from its extractive resources which include mining. These are i) royalties, ii) resource rent iii) State participation and iv) taxes. So far, the component of State participation has not been exploited despite being the most beneficial way. To maximize benefits from mining, government will establish a Mining Company that will be getting into Joint Venture arrangement with foreign companies. Joint Venture arrangements will enable Malawians to be in management team and in the Board of Directors, thereby directly participating in running mining business and curb transfer pricing and other forms of illicit financial flows that often happen in mining industry. Your next government will review tax incentives to ensure Malawians get a fair share of their natural resources.
ny: Pali njira zinayi zomwe dziko lingapindule ndi chuma chake chomwe chimaphatikizapo migodi. Izi ndi i) mafumu, ii) renti ya chuma iii) kutenga nawo mbali kwa boma ndi iv) misonkho. Pakadali pano, gawo la kutenga nawo mbali kwa boma silinagwiritsidwe ntchito ngakhale kuti ndi njira yopindulitsa kwambiri. Kuti apindule kwambiri ndi migodi, boma lidzakhazikitsa kampani ya migodi yomwe idzakhala ikugwirizana ndi makampani akunja. Zogwirizana ndi mgwirizanowu zidzathandiza a Malawi kuti akhale m'gulu la oyang'anira ndi Bungwe la Atsogoleri, motero kutenga nawo mbali mwachindunji poyendetsa bizinesi ya migodi ndi kuchepetsa mitengo yosamutsira ndi mitundu ina ya ndalama zosaloledwa zomwe zimachitika nthawi zambiri m'makampani amigodi. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzawunikiranso zolimbikitsa misonkho kuti zitsimikizire kuti a Malawi apeza gawo labwino pazinthu zawo zachilengedwe.

en: We will approach tourism holistically and contextually. Tourism is about attraction. We will invest in areas that are unique to Malawi, one of them is establishing vibrant cultural centers and packaging our history into a commercial product. Tourism is a beneficiary of derived demand. Our resolve to develop the economy, develop manufacturing sector will positively contribute to the travel and tourism industry. We will make Malawi a destination for citizens of neighboring countries to come and shop. As they come, they will need accommodation and transport just as Malawians do when they travel outside.
ny: Tidzayandikira zokopa alendo kwathunthu komanso mwachilengedwe. Zokopa alendo ndizokhudza kukopa. Tidzayikira m'malo omwe ndi apadera ku Malawi, imodzi mwayo ndikukhazikitsa malo azikhalidwe zamoyo ndikunyamula mbiri yathu kukhala malonda. Ulendo ndiwopindula ndi zomwe zimachokera. Kutsimikiza kwathu kukulitsa chuma, kukulitsa gawo lazopanga kudzathandizira pantchito zoyendera ndi zokopa alendo. Tipanga Malawi kukhala malo oti nzika zamayiko oyandikana nawo abwere kudzagula. Akamabwera, adzafunika malo ogona ndi mayendedwe monga momwe Amalawi amachitira akamayenda kunja.

en: Agriculture transformation, infrastructure revolution, growing of MSMEs, mining, industrialization (manufacturing) and tourism will anchor our job creation agenda.
ny: Kusintha kwa ulimi, kusintha kwa zomangamanga, kukula kwa ma MSME, migodi, kupanga mafakitale (kupanga) ndi zokopa alendo zidzakhazikitsa zolinga zathu zopanga ntchito.

en: My fellow Malawians, I am aware of the key drivers of cost of living. We will overhaul the fuel procurement system in the short-term while investing in cost- effective mode of transport such as rail and pipeline in line with the Malawi National Transport Master Plan. We will review all levies and remove or reduce those that can be done so without compromising public service delivery. We will work to achieve macroeconomic stability with a stable and relatively strong currency to contain imported inflation. In line with Malawi 2063, we will enhance agricultural productivity so that price of food is cheap while farmers still make profit.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndikudziwa zomwe zimapangitsa kuti moyo ukhale wovuta. Tidzakonzanso njira zogulira mafuta munthawi yochepa pomwe tikugwiritsa ntchito njira zoyendera monga njanji ndi mapaipi mogwirizana ndi Malawi National Transport Master Plan. Tidzawunikiranso misonkho yonse ndikuchotsa kapena kuchepetsa zomwe zingachitike popanda kuwononga ntchito zaboma. Tidzagwira ntchito kuti tikwaniritse kukhazikika kwachuma ndi ndalama zokhazikika komanso zolimba kuti tipewe kukwera kwamitengo. Mogwirizana ndi Malawi 2063, tidzawonjezera zokolola zaulimi kuti mtengo wa chakudya ukhale wotsika pomwe alimi akupangabe phindu.

en: We will embark on an ambitious home ownership program in which Malawi Housing Corporation will be recapitalized so it can build houses of different designs to suit your affordability. You will be paying monthly rental fee but which will be going towards purchase of the house. We will make home ownership easy for everyone. A well-thought housing scheme will be implemented in rural areas.
ny: Tidzayamba ntchito yofuna kukhala ndi nyumba yomwe Malawi Housing Corporation idzakhazikitsidwe kuti ipange nyumba zamitundu yosiyanasiyana kuti zigwirizane ndi mtengo wanu. Mudzakhala mukulipira renti ya mwezi uliwonse koma yomwe ipita kukagula nyumba. Tidzapangitsa kukhala ndi nyumba kukhala kosavuta kwa aliyense. Dongosolo loganizira bwino nyumba lidzakhazikitsidwa kumidzi.

en: My fellow Malawians, our approach to improving living standards focuses on containing cost of living on one hand and improving incomes on the other hand while investing in physical and human capital development to put a solid foundation for economic development. That is what your next government will do.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, njira yathu yofuna kukweza moyo wa anthu ndi kuchepetsa mtengo wa moyo mbali imodzi ndi kuonjezera ndalama mbali inayo pamene tikugwiritsa ntchito ndalama zathupi ndi za anthu kuti tikhale ndi maziko olimba a chitukuko cha chuma.

en: Public debt management will be key in getting the economy back on right track. Our resolve to decisively end corruption will free up resources and reduce the need for borrowing. Estimates based on previous government financial audits showed that 30% of the national budget is unaccounted for. When the system is fixed, we will save these funds and spend on intended projects. Our resolve to reform the fiscal plan so we remove unnecessary expenditure and we grow revenue base will reduce the need for borrowing. Reform of foreign missions will free up resources. Where we will have to borrow for legitimate reasons, these questions will guide in determining the source of borrowing; 1) will the loan help grow economy (GDP)? 2) will the loan help either grow tax revenue or reduce expenditure or both? 3) will the loan help grow exports? If the answer is NO especially to 2 and 3, no external loan will be contracted. If a loan still has to be secured, it will be domestic and using a long-term development bond.
ny: Kuwongolera ngongole zaboma kudzakhala kofunikira pakukhazikitsanso chuma. Kutsimikiza mtima kwathu kuthetsa ziphuphu kudzamasula chuma ndikuchepetsa kufunikira kwa ngongole. Ziwerengero zochokera pakuwunika ndalama zaboma m'mbuyomu zidawonetsa kuti 30% ya bajeti yadziko silinafotokozedwe. Dongosolo likakhazikika, tidzasunga ndalamazi ndikuwononga ndalama zomwe tikufuna. Kutsimikiza mtima kwathu kusintha dongosolo lazachuma kuti tichotse ndalama zosafunikira ndikuwonjezera ndalama zomwe tikupeza kudzachepetsa kufunikira kwa ngongole. Kusintha kwa nthumwi zakunja kudzamasula chuma. Pomwe tidzayenera kubwereka pazifukwa zomveka, mafunso awa azitsogolera posankha komwe kubwereketsa ngongole; 1) kodi ngongole ikuthandizira kukula kwachuma (GDP)? ngongole imathandizira kukulitsa ndalama kapena kuchepetsa ndalama za msonkho kapena zonse ziwiri? 3) ngongole imathandizira kukulitsa katundu? Ngati yankho ndi NO makamaka pa 2 ndi 3, palibe ngongole yakunja yomwe idzachitike. Ngati ngongole yakunja ikuyenerabe, idzatetezedwa ndikugwiritsa ntchito ngongole yakunja yakunja.

en: Reducing debt will feed into stimulating private sector development as commercial banks and other lenders will have enough liquidity to lend to private sector at competitive interest rates. Your next government will commit to clearing payment arrears as one way of capacitating private sector to operate fully, expand production and create additional jobs.
ny: Kuchepetsa ngongole kudzathandiza kulimbikitsa chitukuko cha mabungwe apadera monga mabanki amalonda ndi obwereketsa ena adzakhala ndi ndalama zokwanira kubwereketsa mabungwe apadera pa chiwongola dzanja cha mpikisano. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzadzipereka kuthetsa ngongole zomwe zilipo monga njira imodzi yothandizira mabungwe apadera kuti agwire ntchito mokwanira, kuwonjezera kupanga ndi kupanga ntchito zowonjezera.

en: Corruption
ny: Ziphuphu

en: Corruption is a developmental challenge. It is a political campaign issue. Every leader promises to end corruption during political campaign yet corruption continues to worsen. Recent revelations of corruption are evident that our leaders are not only failing to end corruption, they are in fact participating in it.
ny: Ziphuphu ndi vuto la chitukuko. Ndi nkhani ya kampeni yandale. Mtsogoleri aliyense amalonjeza kuthetsa ziphuphu panthawi ya kampeni yandale komabe ziphuphu zikupitilirabe. Zovumbulutsidwa zaposachedwa za ziphuphu zikuwonekeratu kuti atsogoleri athu sikuti akungolephera kuthetsa ziphuphu, koma akuchitapo kanthu.

en: A large part of our poverty is due to corruption. We have had leaders who amass wealth for themselves through corruption and morally questionable entitlements and give us leftovers. Citizens have systematically been economically disempowered so we can depend on them. They use the same corruptly acquired wealth, stolen from the many taxes we pay, to coax us to side with them when they are caught on the wrong side of the law. They project a picture that any criminal investigation in their dealings is the work of their political rivals. We fight on their behalf even when they were the first to kill us through denying us access to education, healthcare, food and job and business opportunities.
ny: Mbali yaikulu ya umphawi wathu ndi chifukwa cha ziphuphu. Takhala ndi atsogoleri amene amadziunjikira chuma kudzera mu ziphuphu ndi ufulu wokayikitsa mwamakhalidwe ndi kutipatsa zotsalira. Nzika zakhala zikulephera mwachuma kotero kuti titha kudalira iwo. Amagwiritsa ntchito chuma chomwecho chopezeka mwachinyengo, chobedwa kuchokera ku misonkho yambiri yomwe timalipira, kuti atipatse ife kuti tiwathandize iwo akagwidwa kumbali yolakwika ya lamulo. Amawonetsera chithunzi chakuti kufufuza kulikonse kwaupandu m'machitidwe awo ndi ntchito ya otsutsana nawo andale. Timamenya nkhondo m'malo mwawo ngakhale pamene anali oyamba kutipha mwa kutiletsa kupeza maphunziro, thanzi, chakudya ndi ntchito ndi mwayi wamalonda.

en: Malawi has enough financial resources to deliver public services adequately. Publicly available information confirm that it is possible to run a government without heavy borrowing. For example, it is alleged that in one contract, a business person charged government US$10,524,000 for goods that cost the business person US$2,165,700 making abnormal profit of US$8,358,300. Surely this is over- pricing and stealing from poor Malawians.
ny: Malawi ali ndi ndalama zokwanira kupereka mautumiki a boma mokwanira. Chidziŵitso chopezeka poyera chimatsimikizira kuti nkotheka kuyendetsa boma popanda kukongola kwambiri. Mwachitsanzo, akuti m'pangano lina, munthu wamalonda analipira boma US$10,524,000 pa katundu amene anathera munthu wamalonda US$2,165,700 kupanga phindu loposa loyenera la US$8,358,300. Ndithudi izi ndizo kukwera mtengo kwambiri ndi kuba kwa Amalawi osauka.

en:
Fellow Malawians, we all can see that the main problem in Malawi is not inadequate resources but corruption and excessive and expensive entitlements of senior public officers. Fighting corruption must be a top priority for a government. That is not the case unfortunately. Some of the reasons corruption is not ending include the expensive type of political campaign and the parasitic political party system. Statistics confirm that Malawi is a least developed country hence it is a country whose people are poor and by extension, a country whose politicians are poor. The type of political campaign that is practiced is expensive and breeds a fertile ground for advance State capture by those who bankroll the campaign. Corrupt business
people finance greedy politicians in anticipation of easy access to business contracts once the politician or political party is in power. This is what has sustained State capture.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, tonse tikuona kuti vuto lalikulu m'Malawi si chuma chochepa koma ndi ziphuphu komanso ndalama zambiri zomwe akuluakulu aboma amalipira. Kulimbana ndi ziphuphu kuyenera kukhala chinthu chofunikira kwambiri kuboma. Tsoka ilo, sizili choncho. Zina mwa zifukwa zomwe ziphuphu sizikutha ndi mtundu wokwera mtengo wa ndale komanso dongosolo lachipani cha ndale. Ziwerengero zimatsimikizira kuti Malawi ndi dziko lopanda chitukuko motero ndi dziko lomwe anthu ake ndi osauka ndipo chifukwa chake, ndi dziko lomwe andale ake ndi osauka. Mtundu wa ndale womwe umachitika ndi wokwera mtengo ndipo umabweretsa nthaka yachonde kuti asunge Boma ndi omwe amalipiritsa kampeniyi. Anthu achinyengo amabizinesi amalipiritsa andale adyera poyembekezera mwayi wopeza mapangano abizinesi pomwe wandale kapena chipani chandale chikhala ndi mphamvu. Izi ndi zomwe zakhala zikugwira ntchito.

en: In State capture, the loser is the citizenry. Politicians influence award of government contracts to corrupt business people at inflated prices. The inflated prices are because the corrupt business people want to i) recover the money they spent to bankroll campaign, ii) sell the goods and services at a profit and iii) give part of the payment to the politicians so they remain connected. When the politicians get part of the payment they use part of the money for their personal projects and part of it for campaign materials and other political expenses. That is why the fight against corruption cannot be won if we continue using the same political campaign model. In fact, there are politicians who have established businesses out of money acquired in this way. Their businesses get contracts from the same government they stole capital from. In other words, our tax money has become business capital for greedy politicians and the businesses get contracts from government where they are paid by our tax money again. This is the height of impunity in Malawi. We all have a responsibility to stop this.
ny: M'boma la anthu, wotayika ndi nzika. andale amalimbikitsa kupereka kwa mabungwe aboma kwa anthu amalonda achinyengo pamtengo wokwera. Mitengo yokwera ndi chifukwa chakuti anthu amalonda achinyengo akufuna i) kubwezeretsa ndalama zomwe adawononga kuti apereke ndalama zampikisano, ii) kugulitsa katundu ndi ntchito ndi phindu ndipo iii) kupereka gawo la ndalama kwa andale kuti akhalebe olumikizidwa. Pamene andale atenga gawo la ndalamazo amagwiritsa ntchito gawo la ndalamazo pazinthu zawo komanso gawo lina pazinthu zampikisano ndi ndalama zina zandale. Ichi ndichifukwa chake nkhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu singapambane ngati tipitiliza kugwiritsa ntchito njira yomweyo zandale. M'malo mwake, pali andale omwe adakhazikitsa mabizinesi kuchokera ku ndalama zomwe adapeza mwanjira imeneyi. Mabizinesi awo amabera mabungwe aboma omwe adabera ndalama zawo. Mwanjira ina, ndalama zathu za misonkho zasandukanso bizinesi kwa andale komanso mabizinesi adyera omwe amalandila mabungwe aboma komwe amalipira ndi ndalama zathu za misonkho. Uku ndi kutalika kwa Malawi Tonse tili ndi udindo woletsa izi.

en: My fellow Malawians, let me illustrate how corruption causes poverty. Suppose there was money enough to construct three school blocks but due to corruption the price is inflated and the money can only construct two school blocks. Suppose each school block has two classrooms that can accommodate 60 learners. Further, suppose constructing a school block offers job opportunity to ten people as bricklayers, carpenters and others. By constructing two instead of three school blocks because of inflated prices, the results are as follows
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndiloleni ndifotokoze mmene ziphuphu zimayambitsira umphawi. Tiyerekeze kuti panali ndalama zokwanira kumanga nyumba zitatu za sukulu koma chifukwa cha ziphuphu mtengo wake unakwezedwa ndipo ndalamazo zimangomanga nyumba ziwiri za sukulu. Tiyerekeze kuti nyumba ya sukulu iliyonse ili ndi makalasi awiri omwe angathe kukhala ndi ophunzira 60. Komanso, tiyerekeze kuti kumanga nyumba ya sukulu kumapereka mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu khumi monga omanga njerwa, amisiri ndi ena. Tikamangitsa nyumba ziwiri m'malo mwa nyumba zitatu za sukulu chifukwa cha mitengo yochulukirapo, zotsatira zake ndi izi:

en: Three blocks would have made 360 learners move from learning under a tree to a proper classroom, but due to corruption only 240 learners will be in a good classroom. The other 120 learners will continue learning under a tree yet money was available to put them in a good classroom.
ny: Mabwalo atatu akanatha kupanga ophunzira 360 kuchoka ku kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo kupita ku kalasi yoyenera, koma chifukwa cha ziphuphu ophunzira 240 okha ndi omwe adzakhala mkalasi yabwino. Ophunzira ena 120 apitiliza kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo komabe ndalama zinalipo kuti awaike mkalasi yabwino.

en: Constructing three school blocks would create employment opportunities to 30 people. By constructing two, it means 10 people who would have some work to do still have no job.
ny: Kumanga nyumba zitatu za sukulu kukapanga mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu 30. Kumanga nyumba ziŵiri kumatanthauza kuti anthu 10 amene angakhale ndi ntchito yoti agwire alibe ntchito.

en: Since there is corruption, there is high likelihood that the two school blocks may be of substandard quality. They may need maintenance quicker than if construction was not marred with corruption. Additional resources are likely to be spent to rehabilitate the same school blocks when the resources would have been spent on other functions.
ny: Popeza pali ziphuphu, pali kuthekera kwakukulu kuti mabwalo awiriwa a sukulu atha kukhala osavomerezeka. Iwo angafunikire kukonza mwachangu kuposa momwe zomangamanga sizikanakhalira ndi ziphuphu. Ndalama zowonjezera zikuyenera kugwiritsidwa ntchito kukonzanso mabwalo omwewo a sukulu pomwe ndalamazo zikadagwiritsidwa ntchito pazinthu zina.

en: If children are learning under a tree; if there are no drugs in health facilities; if there are no all-weather roads in some areas; if jobs are scarce; if we Malawians are poor; one of the main causes is corruption.
ny: Ngati ana akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo; ngati mulibe mankhwala m'malo a zaumoyo; ngati mulibe misewu ya nyengo zonse m'madera ena; ngati ntchito zili zochepa; ngati ife a ku Malawi ndife osauka; chimodzi mwa zifukwa zazikulu ndicho ziphuphu.

en: Our approach to the fight against corruption starts from the process of getting into office. We will not do the traditional political campaign you have known. We will not do because we do not want to get money from corrupt business people so that when you vote us into office we serve them instead of serving you, Malawians.
ny: Njira yathu yolimbana ndi ziphuphu imayamba kuchokera pa nthawi imene tikukhala pa udindo. Sitidzachita kampeni ya ndale yomwe mwadziwa kale. Sitidzachita chifukwa sitikufuna kupeza ndalama kuchokera kwa anthu amalonda achinyengo kuti mukadzativotera ife kukhala pa udindo tidzawatumikire iwo m'malo mokutumikirani inu a Malawi.

en: We will not form a political party because it is an expensive organization that contributes to temptation of political leaders to indulge in corruption and when in office, abuse public resources to fund the political party. You can relate this to some of the revelations that are coming out now of how public institutions financed activities of a political party. We do not want to tie ourselves to the yokes that have chained the others. More importantly, not forming a political party means that there will be no group of people (members of the ruling party) that feels and behaves as more important than the rest of Malawians. Between me and the public service, there will be no person or group of people to terrorize public servants on the premise that they are the ruling party members.
ny: Sitidzapanga chipani chifukwa ndi bungwe la ndalama zambiri lomwe limapangitsa kuti atsogoleri andale azichita zachinyengo ndipo akakhala paudindo, amagwiritsa ntchito ndalama za boma kuti azilipira chipani. Mutha kulumikizana ndi izi ndi zina mwazomwe zikuwululidwa tsopano za momwe mabungwe aboma amathandizira zochitika za chipani chandale. Sitikufuna kuti tidzimangirire ku goli lomwe limamanga ena. Chofunika kwambiri, kusapanga chipani chandale kumatanthauza kuti sipadzakhala gulu la anthu (mamembala achipani cholamulira) omwe amamva komanso kuchita zinthu ngati ofunika kuposa Amalawi ena onse. Pakati pa ine ndi ntchito yaboma, sipadzakhala munthu kapena gulu la anthu kuti liziopseza ogwira ntchito zaboma poganiza kuti ndi mamembala achipani cholamulira.

en: It is not an exaggeration to say that political parties have been a disuniting factor so far in Malawi as they have been catalyst for tribalism and nepotism. You may appreciate the observation that in some political parties, it does not matter how loyal and qualified a member is, if they do not come from a particular region or from a particular tribe they cannot be voted president of a party to have a chance to contest as president of a country. We must for a moment dismantle this construct and create a political system that gives hope to every Malawian everywhere that they can be anything including President of Malawi if they work hard, have qualifications and have the integrity to serve their nation. I am convinced that being a president without a political party will foster nation building.
ny: Sizokokokomeza kunena kuti zipani zandale zakhala zikugwedeza mpaka pano ku Malawi chifukwa zakhala zikukopa mafuko ndi ma nepotism. Mungathe kuzindikira kuti m'magulu ena andale, ziribe kanthu kuti membala ndi wokhulupirika komanso woyenera bwanji, ngati sachokera kudera linalake kapena fuko linalake sangathe kuvota kukhala Purezidenti wa chipani kuti akhale ndi mwayi wotsutsana ngati Purezidenti wa dziko. Tiyenera kwa kanthawi kuthetsa izi ndikupanga dongosolo lazandale lomwe limapatsa chiyembekezo kwa Amalawi kulikonse kuti atha kukhala chilichonse kuphatikiza Purezidenti wa Malawi ngati agwira ntchito molimbika, ali ndi ziyeneretso komanso ali ndi umphumphu wotumikira dziko lawo. Ndine wotsimikiza kuti kukhala Purezidenti wopanda chipani chandale kumalimbikitsa kumanga dziko.

en: Additionally, as your leader, I will have all my focus on running government, rather than divide my focus between running government on one hand and running a political party on the other hand.
ny: Kuwonjezera apo, monga mtsogoleri wanu, ndidzangoganizira kwambiri za kayendetsedwe ka boma, m'malo mogawa maganizo anga pakati pa kuyendetsa boma mbali imodzi ndi kuyendetsa chipani cha ndale mbali inayo.

en: Fighting corruption is a war. Being a war, it needs troops who are loyal to their nation, troops who are well-trained and well-resourced. Above all, troops who are best commanded. The agencies responsible for fighting corruption are the troops. The President is the commander. Like in a military war, if troops are compromised, it is difficult to win the fight against corruption. If the commander is compromised, it is impossible to win the fight against corruption.
ny: Kulimbana ndi ziphuphu ndi nkhondo. Kukhala nkhondo, pamafunika asilikali omwe ali okhulupirika ku dziko lawo, asilikali omwe ali ophunzitsidwa bwino komanso omwe ali ndi chuma chokwanira. Koposa zonse, asilikali omwe ali ndi ulamuliro wabwino. Mabungwe omwe ali ndi udindo wolimbana ndi ziphuphu ndi asilikali. Purezidenti ndi mtsogoleri. Monga nkhondo yankhondo, ngati asilikali asokonezeka, ndi zovuta kupambana nkhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu. Ngati mtsogoleriyo asokonezeka, n'zosatheka kupambana nkhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: For the reason that we will not get into office through a corrupt process, you can be assured that my team and I will fight against corruption decisively for we will not be haunted by our own involvement in the same. I will take it my prime responsibility that the fight against corruption is ably commanded and that if there are elements of compromised loyalty in the troops, I take corrective measures. I can guarantee that under my stewardship, no effort will be spared to fight corruption.
ny: Chifukwa chakuti sitidzalowa mu udindo kudzera mu ndondomeko ya ziphuphu, mungatsimikize kuti ine ndi gulu langa tidzamenyana ndi ziphuphu mwamphamvu chifukwa sitidzakhala ndi vuto ndi zomwe ifeyo timalowerera. Ndidzatenga udindo wanga waukulu kuti nkhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu ikulamulidwa bwino ndipo ngati pali zinthu zosokoneza kukhulupirika m'magulu, ndimatenga njira zowongolera. Ndingatsimikizire kuti pansi pa utsogoleri wanga, palibe khama lomwe lidzapulumutsidwa polimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: The future of Malawi leadership
ny: Tsogolo la utsogoleri wa Malawi

en: Fellow Malawians, I understand the frustration among well-meaning Malawians. I am aware that some of you have lost interest in voting in next election because we have been disappointed by the political administrations we have had. I come to give hope. I come to restore the courage we always have had, believing that as citizens, power is in our hands to make a leadership that has i) integrity, ii) technical and administrative competence and iii) desire to serve.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndikumvetsetsa kukhumudwa kwa anthu a Malawi omwe ali ndi zolinga zabwino. Ndikudziwa kuti ena mwa inu mwataya chidwi chovota pachisankho chotsatira chifukwa takhumudwitsidwa ndi maboma andale omwe takhala nawo. Ndabwera kudzapereka chiyembekezo. Ndabwera kudzathetsa kulimba mtima komwe takhala nako nthawi zonse, ndikukhulupirira kuti monga nzika, mphamvu ili m'manja mwathu kuti apange utsogoleri womwe uli ndi i) umphumphu, ii) luso ndi luso la kayendetsedwe ka ntchito ndi iii) chikhumbo chotumikira.

en: The 2025 presidential election will be a ‘referendum’ - a choice between maintaining impunity versus ending impunity; a choice between maintaining mediocrity versus a launch of meritocracy; a choice between politicians versus leaders.
ny: Chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 chidzakhala "kuvota" - kusankha pakati pa kusunga ufulu wosalakwa ndi kuthetsa ufulu wosalakwa; kusankha pakati pa kusunga khalidwe laling'ono ndi kukhazikitsa ulamuliro wa anthu; kusankha pakati pa andale ndi atsogoleri.

en: To echo the words of Barack Obama, former President of the USA, “we did not inherit the country from our ancestors so we can feel a sense of entitlement, rather we borrowed it from our children and the generations to come and therefore we have an obligation to hand over a better country to them”.
ny: Kuti ndifotokoze mawu a Barack Obama, yemwe anali Purezidenti wa dziko la United States, "sitinalandire dzikoli kwa makolo athu kuti tikhale ndi ufulu, koma tinalitenga kwa ana athu ndi mibadwo yomwe ikubwera ndipo chifukwa chake tili ndi udindo wopereka dziko labwino kwa iwo".

en: We have a responsibility to change the narrative that politics is for the few rich Malawians more so those getting rich through corruption and theft of public resources. We have a duty to change the narrative that politics is for crooks, liars, the incompetent and that politics is risky.
ny: Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yomwe imati ndale ndi za anthu ochepa olemera a ku Malawi makamaka omwe amapeza chuma kudzera mu ziphuphu ndi kuba chuma cha boma. Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yomwe imati ndale ndi za achinyengo, abodza, osadziwa ntchito komanso kuti ndale ndizowopsa.

en: My colleagues and I are at your service and are determined to make personal sacrifices for the sake of presenting a real choice to you in the next elections. We come so that as voters you are not faced with a choice between lemons and grapefruits (manyumwa), for both are sour. We come to be your real choice. We know the contenders are heavily armoured with resources, including those they stole from our taxes.
ny: Ine ndi anzanga tili pantchito yanu ndipo tili otsimikiza mtima kudzipereka tokha kuti tikhale ndi chisankho chenicheni kwa inu pachisankho chotsatira. Tikubwera kuti inu monga ovota musayang'ane chisankho pakati pa mandimu ndi zipatso za mphesa (manyumwa), chifukwa zonsezo ndi zowawa. Tikubwera kukhala chisankho chanu chenicheni. Tikudziwa kuti omwe akupikisana nawo ali ndi zida zankhondo, kuphatikiza zomwe adabera misonkho yathu.

en: We are armoured with faith. We believe we shall succeed with your support. We are ready to govern and to do so competently. I have the right training, experience and exposure to public policy to competently develop the economy and run the public service. As you may appreciate, the duty of any government is two-fold; i) to develop the economy with the aim of improving people’s living standards and ii) to manage the public service so it can deliver public goods and services to people professionally, efficiently and effectively. I promise to deliver on these two cardinal roles in an excellent manner.
ny: Tili ndi chikhulupiriro. Tikukhulupirira kuti tidzapambana ndi thandizo lanu. Ndife okonzeka kulamulira ndi kuchita zimenezo mwaluso. Ndili ndi maphunziro oyenera, chidziwitso ndi kuwonekera kwa ndondomeko ya boma kuti ndikhale ndi luso lokonza chuma ndi kuyendetsa ntchito za boma. Monga momwe mungamvetsere, ntchito ya boma iliyonse ili ndi magawo awiri; i) kukhazikitsa chuma ndi cholinga chokweza moyo wa anthu ndi ii) kuyendetsa ntchito za boma kuti athe kupereka katundu ndi ntchito kwa anthu mwaukadaulo, moyenera komanso moyenera. Ndikulonjeza kuti ndikwaniritsa maudindo awiriwa mwabwino kwambiri.

en: I appeal to you Malawians to support my candidacy. I am ready to serve you. In a special way, I encourage the youth to take 2025 election as uniquely important for I, one of their own, will be on the ballot paper. I am going to run the government in ways that will prove that the youth in Malawi are ready for the task. I will take it my additional responsibility to bring public confidence in the youth and in doing so clear a way for all youth who seek elected positions. I promise a government that will be at your service. I promise an administration that will be the moral campass of the nation.
ny: Ndikulankhula kwa inu a Malawi kuti muthandizire chisankho changa. Ndine wokonzeka kukutumikirani. Mwapadera, ndikulimbikitsa achinyamata kuti atenge chisankho cha 2025 kukhala chofunikira kwambiri chifukwa ine, m'modzi wa iwo, ndidzakhala pa pepala lovota. Ndiyendetsa boma m'njira zomwe zingatsimikizire kuti achinyamata ku Malawi ali okonzeka pantchitoyi. Ndidzatenga udindo wanga wowonjezera kuti ndibweretse chidaliro cha anthu kwa achinyamata ndipo potero ndikumasula njira kwa achinyamata onse omwe akufuna maudindo osankhidwa. Ndikulonjeza boma lomwe lidzakuthandizani. Ndikulonjeza oyang'anira omwe adzakhala kampasi yachikhalidwe cha dziko.

en: Let us together make 2025 election a turning point for Malawi. Let us together uproot the breed of corrupt, incompetent and nepotistic politicians and plant a new breed of leaders that will be a symbol of integrity, competence and service. As late Lee Kuan Yew, founding Prime Minister of Singapore said, “we need the best and ablest in politics, not charlatans with a gift of the gab”. Let us together sanitize politics in Malawi. Politics will become clean when clean people replace the dirty ones who have made it dirty.
ny: Tiyeni tonse pamodzi tipange chisankho cha 2025 kukhala chosintha zinthu ku Malawi. Tiyeni tonse pamodzi tichotse mtundu wa andale achinyengo, osadziwa ntchito ndi okonda achibale ndikubzala mtundu watsopano wa atsogoleri omwe adzakhala chizindikiro cha umphumphu, luso ndi ntchito. Monga momwe Lee Kuan Yew, yemwe adayambitsa Prime Minister waku Singapore adanenera, "tikufuna zabwino kwambiri komanso zokhoza kwambiri m'ndale, osati achinyengo omwe ali ndi mphatso ya gabus". Tiyeni tonse pamodzi tiyeretse ndale ku Malawi. Ndale zidzakhala zoyera anthu oyera akadzalowa m'malo mwa anthu onyansa omwe adaipangitsa kukhala yonyansa.

en: I am appealing to every Malawian to engage our conscience and think of a Malawi we would want our children and grandchildren to live in. It does not matter what our current position is, what matters is the responsibility we have to ensure we hand over a better country to our children and grandchildren. You may be a serving member of the cabinet, an advisor, a senior public officer, a political party member who genuinely believes things are not the way you would have wanted to serve the nation. I ask you to support my candidacy. Tell your family and relatives to vote for me in 2025 presidential election.
ny: Ndikulankhula kwa aliyense wa ku Malawi kuti atenge chikumbumtima chake ndikuganiza za Malawi yomwe tikufuna kuti ana athu ndi adzukulu athu azikhala. Zilibe kanthu kuti udindo wathu ndi uti, chofunika ndi udindo womwe tili nawo kuti tiwonetsetse kuti tikupatsa ana athu ndi adzukulu athu dziko labwino. Mutha kukhala membala wa nduna, mlangizi, mkulu waboma, membala wa chipani chandale yemwe amakhulupirira moona mtima kuti zinthu sizili momwe mungafunire kutumikira dziko. Ndikukupemphani kuti muthandizire kuyimilira kwanga. Uzani banja lanu ndi abale anu kuti andivotere pachisankho cha 2025 cha purezidenti.

en: I request you all who are in support of my candidacy to convince others around you. Convince your family members, your village mates, your village head leaders.Tell them the candidate of choice in 2025 presidential election has been identified and he is Milward Tobias. That will be your greatest contribution to my campaign.
ny: Ndikupempha nonse amene mukuthandiza kuti ndikhale phungu kuti mukhulupirire anthu ena omwe muli nawo pafupi. Limbikitsani achibale anu, anzanu akumudzi, atsogoleri am'mudzi mwanu. Auzeni kuti amene akufuna kukhala phungu pa chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 wadziwika ndipo ndi Milward Tobias. Imeneyi idzakhala ntchito yanu yaikulu pa kampeni yanga.

en: To my colleagues; the road will be tough but we are ready for it and we will succeed. We will succeed because we are carrying the hopes of many Malawians who have been yearning for a leadership that can serve them, not one that serves a small group and corrupt business people. Malawians are looking for a leadership that has the integrity to tell the truth, to be accountable and transparent and to develop Malawi. It is high time Malawians became proud again of being Malawian.
ny: Kwa anzanga; msewu udzakhala wovuta koma ndife okonzeka ndipo tidzapambana. Tidzapambana chifukwa tili ndi chiyembekezo cha anthu ambiri a ku Malawi omwe akhala akufuna utsogoleri womwe ungawathandize, osati womwe ungathandize kagulu kakang'ono ndi anthu amalonda achinyengo.
